item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

ok found it,
it was’nt so hard, just needed to find the place:

to let it stop make it alike this:

if(playerX <= 3258 && playerY <= 9852) { pkingOn(); }

see.

item.title: How do you set pk boundries?
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

oh yea forgot to say,

if(playerX >= 3258 && playerY >= 9852) { pkingOn(); }
the > and the < tells you what needs to be bigger or lesser (like a lesser demon :D just kidding)

if you take something alike " >= 2514 && >= 9852 "
then the pk boundrie is more then xposition 2514 and yposition 9852

i think you would know now i think.

edit: to make the bank safe, use the coords outside the bank
and then it’ll make the bank safe.
i think

if(playerX >= && playerY >= ) { pkingOn(); }
only thing in this threath that would help i'll tell more about it:

if(playerX >= 3258 && playerY >= 9852) { pkingOn(); }

make it like this, but, erm, those coords are’nt right coords, just an example

the first coord is the x coord (simple i think)
the second coord is the y coord (same ^ as above)
hope this helps.
